snippet: The founding documents of our democracy were products of debate, revision and compromise, which could have turned out differently.
abstract: Editorial observes that to celebrate Fourth of July, New York Public Library is displaying drafts of Declaration of Independence and Bill of Rights side by side for first time; contends it is good reminder that these founding documents of democracy, often treated as inevitable and immutable, were products of debate, revision and compromise, which could have turned out differently.
lead_paragraph: The founding documents of our democracy were products of debate, revision and compromise, which could have turned out differently.

headline.main: When the Bill of Rights Had 12 Amendments
headline.print_headline: When the Bill of Rights Had 12 Amendments
